intro: Fuirena lainzii, commonly known as the Lainz's fuirena, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in complex, branched clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Fuirena lainzii is considered a species of conservation concern.
